subject: Web3
title: NFTs as Proof of Attendance
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: NFTs as Proof of Attendance.

hook.text: POAPs are NFTs that prove you attended an event. Think of them as digital stamps in a passport.

buildup.text: Event organizers issue POAPs to attendees. Each token is a unique badge stored in your wallet.

discovery.text: POAPs have been used at conferences, concerts, hackathons, and even online community calls.

twist.text: Some projects use POAPs for access control. Hold certain badges and you unlock exclusive content or votes.

climax.text: POAPs show NFTs working quietly and usefully â€” no speculation, no hype, just proof of experience.

punchline.text: Digital badges that prove 'I was there.' No hype needed.

quiz.question: What is a POAP?
options: An NFT that proves attendance at an event
